intro: Hieracium sylvaticum var. subtenue, commonly known as the slender wood hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with ray florets. It is a perennial herb that produces achenes as its seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
